message.content:
cs.DL, cs.CY, cs.IR, cs.SI, cs.CR 

Reasoning: The paper discusses the use of bibliometric indicators in the evaluation of applicants for academic positions, which is relevant to several sub-categories in computer science. Specifically, cs.DL (Digital Libraries) is a likely category as the paper discusses the use of bibliometric indicators in evaluating academic research. cs.CY (Computers and Society) is also a possible category as the paper discusses issues related to the evaluation of academic performance. cs.IR (Information Retrieval) is another possible category as the paper discusses the use of bibliometric indicators to evaluate research output. cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) is a possible category as the paper discusses the evaluation of academic performance at a national level. Finally, cs.CR (Cryptography and Security) is a possible category as the paper discusses issues related to the definition and use of bibliometric indicators.
